stanza.line: Since I left you mine eye is in my mindmind
And that which governs me to go aboutabout
Doth part his function and is partly blindblind
Seems seeing but effectually is outout
For it no form delivers to the heartheart
Of bird of flower or shape which it doth latchlatch
Of his quick objects hath the mind no partpart
Nor his own vision holds what it doth catchcatch
For if it see the rud or gentlest sightsight
The most sweet favour or deformed creaturecreature
The mountain or the sea the day or nightnight
The crow or dove it shapes them to your featurefeature
Incapable of more replete with youyou
My most true mind thus maketh mine untrueuntrue
